original: The wounds inflicted by a club are generally known as bludgeoning or blunt-force trauma injuries.
simplified: The injuries caused by a club are called bludgeoning or blunt force trauma injuries.

original: Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan border Afghanistan to the north, Iran to the west, Pakistan to the south and the People's Republic of China to the east.
simplified: The countries that border Tajikistan are Afghanistan to the north, Pakistan to the south, Iran to the west, and China to the east.

original: Seventy-five defencemen are in the Hall of Fame, more than any other current position, while only 35 goaltenders have been inducted.
simplified: Seventy-five defencemen are in the Hockey Hall of Fame. || Only 35 goaltenders have been added to the Hall of Fame.

original: There he had one daughter, later baptized as Mary Ann Fisher Power, to Ann (e) Power.
simplified: His wife was Ann (e) Power. || His daughter was named Mary Ann Fisher Power.

original: The New York City Housing Authority Police Department was a law enforcement agency in New York City that existed from 1952 to 1995.
simplified: The New York City Housing Authority Police Department was a police department in New York City that was started in 1952.

original: This was demonstrated in the Miller-Urey experiment by Stanley L. Miller and Harold C. Urey in 1953.
simplified: This was shown to be true by Stanley L. Miller and Harold C. Urey in 1953.

original: Fives is a British sport believed to derive from the same origins as many racquet sports.
simplified: Fives is a British sport. || It has the same origin as many other racquet sports.

original: The body color varies from medium brown to gold-ish to beige-white; and occasionally, is marked with dark brown spots, especially on the limbs.
simplified: The color of their body varies from medium brown to gold-ish to beige-white. || Sometimes, they have dark brown spots on their body.

original: In return, Rollo swore fealty to Charles, converted to Christianity, and undertook to defend the northern region of France against the incursions of other Viking groups.
simplified: In return, Rollo swore fealty to Charles and converted to Christianity. || He also promised to defend the northern part of France from other Viking groups.

original: Val Venis defeated Rikishi in a Steel cage match to retain the WWF Intercontinental Championship (14:10) Venis pinned Rikishi after Tazz hit Rikishi with a TV camera.
simplified: Val Venis won against Rikishi to keep the WWF Intercontinental Championship (14:10) Venis pinned Rikishi after hitting him with a TV camera.

original: The sheer weight of the continental icecap sitting on top of Lake Vostok is believed to contribute to the high oxygen concentration.
simplified: The sheer weight of the continental icecap sitting on top of Lake Vostok makes it easy for oxygen to get into the lake.

original: Terms such as "undies" for underwear and "movie" for "moving picture" are oft-heard terms in English.
simplified: For example, "undies" means "underwear" in English, and "movie" means "moving picture".

original: The spacecraft consists of two main elements: the NASA Cassini orbiter, named after the Italian-French astronomer Giovanni Domenico Cassini, and the ESA Huygens probe, named after the Dutch astronomer, mathematician and physicist Christiaan Huygens.
simplified: The spacecraft consists of two main parts: the Cassini orbiter, named after the Italian-French astronomer Giovanni Domenico Cassini, and the Huygens probe, named after Christiaan Huygens, a Dutch mathematician and physicist.

original: Barneville-la-Bertran is a commune in the Calvados department in the Basse-Normandie region in northwestern France.
simplified: It is found in the region Basse-Normandie in the Calvados department in the northwest of France.
